title: looking for angular scripts
content: and i mean really angular. none of these soft curves or nuffin. (well maybe just a touch) there have to be some out there, but i just went through all the scripts on myfonts and didn't find a one... on to veer...
author: paul d hunt

comments.content: Paul, go to Mike Yang's script identification guide and research.

[Laser](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223824/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.102962.0.0) and [Rapier](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223824/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.2730.0.0) by Martin Wait  
 [Coptek](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223824/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.6587.0.0), [Bronx](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223824/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.2566.0.0), and [Scriptek](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223824/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.2566.0.0) by David Quay

Not really a script but attractively angular [Preissig Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414223824/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/preissig/preissig-text-italic/)

Tim
